item.title: Finally understanding decorators in Python
item.description: Python is a very beginner-friendly language. However, it also has some more advanced features that can be hard to grasp. For me at least, decorators were one of them. I was seeing them here and there but never fully understood what they did and how they worked, even after reading a bunch of stuff about them. Until I came across the talk ‘So you want to be a Python expert’ by James Powell in which he explains four key features of Python, including decorators.

item.title: Understanding precision and recall
item.description: Precision, recall and the derived concepts are very important in Machine Learning (and more generally in statistics) yet can be hard to grasp. In this article I explain what they are, why they are useful and how to use them. What’s the point ? First off, it’s important to understand why those concepts were introduced and why they are useful. I am going to use an example throughout this post to make things clearer.

item.title: Setting Up a First Personal Website
item.description: Having a personal website is very useful, for many reasons. However, building one is sometimes a bit difficult. Of course there’s WordPress, but it can feel a bit heavy, and too abstract for someone who likes to code. On the other hand, Web Development is not easy and can be time consuming. Here I’ll describe how I went about making my personal website (this one) and how I deployed it on GitHub Pages.

item.title: Roadmap to ML
item.description: This is my roadmap to go from an undergraduate CS and math background to a very good understanding of Machine Learning and Deep Learning concepts, and more importantly to successfully apply ML and DL. I will put here everything I’ve done (in italic), I’m doing (in bold), and I’m planning on doing (normal text) in order to reach that goal. Courses Andrew Ng’s Coursera Machine Learning course fast.ai course part 1 v3 Udacity Intro to deep learning with PyTorch fast.

item.title: About me
item.description: Hello there ! I’m a CS student who discovered Machine Learning in 2018 and who has been working hard to learn it since then. I’m especially interested in Deep Learning. I’m a strong believer in self-learning. So in addition to my French engineering school, I take MOOCs and build things to learn and practice. For example, I attended version 3 of the fast.ai course live from October to December — a rather tough planning for me because the classes were beginning at 3 am France time and my engineering class started at 8 am, but great course.
